spotifyConsent.title: Spotify Permission Required
spotifyConsent.description: Nonna.fm needs permission to read your Spotify playlists and liked songs to transfer them to other services.
dataUsageList: We only read your music data to transfer it
We never store your playlists permanently
We don't share your data with third parties
spotifyConsent.learnMore: Learn more about our privacy practices in our Privacy Policy.

spotifyTerms.title: Spotify Terms of Service
spotifyTerms.intro: Before using Spotify with Nonna.fm, please note:
termsItems: Nonna.fm makes no warranties or representations on behalf of Spotify and expressly disclaims all implied warranties with respect to the Spotify Platform, Spotify Service and Spotify Content, including the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement.
You agree to not modify or create derivative works based on the Spotify Platform, Spotify Service or Spotify Content.

You agree to not decompile, reverse-engineer, disassemble, or otherwise reduce the Spotify Platform, Spotify Service, and Spotify Content to source code or other human-perceivable form, to the full extent allowed by law.
Nonna.fm is solely responsible for this application and Spotify has no liability related to your use of this service.
Spotify is a third party beneficiary of our terms of service and privacy policy and is entitled to directly enforce these terms.
spotifyTerms.privacyIntro: While using our service with Spotify, please be aware:
privacyItems: Our collection and use of data is subject to our privacy policy.
We collect and use information about your Spotify playlists, saved songs, and related metadata solely for providing the playlist transfer service.
All processing of your data happens directly in your browser. We do not store your Spotify data on our servers.
For questions about your information, please contact us via our support channels.
We do not place cookies on your browser beyond what is necessary for authentication.
We do not allow third parties to place cookies on your browser to track browsing activities.
You can manage cookies through your browser settings if you wish to control them.

deezerConnect.description: To transfer your music to Deezer, you'll need to connect your account.

Accessibility.howToFindProfileId: How to find your Deezer profile ID

LoadingOverlay.gettingReady: Just a moment while we get everything ready

whyNeedId.title: Why do we need your profile ID?
whyNeedId.explanation: Deezer works differently from other platforms. To connect your account, we need your profile ID - it's like your unique username for Deezer.
whyNeedId.technicalDetails: As of 2024, Deezer no longer accepts new OAuth application registrations for third-party developers. This means we can't use the traditional OAuth flow like we do with Spotify and YouTube. Instead, we use your public profile ID to access your public playlists, which is still allowed under Deezer's API terms.

makePublic.title: Make your profile public:
makePublic.step1: Log in to your Deezer account and go to
makePublic.step2: You should see your social sharing settings
makePublic.step3: Make sure the "Private profile" option is disabled

getId.title: Get your Deezer profile ID:
getId.instructions: Go to your favourites, copy your profile ID from the URL:
getId.imageAlt: How to find your Deezer profile ID

privacy.line1: We only use this data for the transfer process.
privacy.line2: We don't store any of your data permanently.
